channel.title: Comments on: Comparing the Chicago Highway System to your Disaster/Recovery Plans
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: iUSA
item.dc:creator: iUSA
item.description: I'm sure every state has parts of highways with terrible traffic...
item.content:encoded: I’m sure every state has parts of highways with terrible traffic…

item.title: By: Jerry Hung
item.dc:creator: Jerry Hung
item.content:encoded:
ðŸ™‚ what else is new, money fixes everything

And the problem with highways/roads are that most of them have reached, if not overreached their designed capacity.

I know the 401 in Ontario, especially Toronto segments, is 6X its designed capacity? so any minor issue will disrupt the flow significantly

It’s a funny read nonetheless, thanks

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
You could have easily picked the BQE (Brooklyn Queens Express Way) in New York or Route 1 in New Jersey

I am sure every state has the same miserable drivers
